programmes.show_description: A Traitor to Memory: Crime-cracking adventures with Nathaniel Parker as the aristocratic detective. Is a violinist connected to the death of a woman in a hit-and-run incident?
Dead Man Talking: Amanda Redman and James Bolam star in the popular mystery caper. The team investigates when a psychic claims to be in touch with the spirit of a wealthy man.
Murder in the Dark: First Chapter: Newly-promoted Detective Sergeant Matilda 'Mattie' Stone is reunited with her crime-writing aunts when she is assigned to her hometown.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
All Day and All of the Night: More fun with the Essex sisters. Sharon worries about odd goings on at the cafe, while Dorien believes she has turned into the Goddess of Love.
Lola: Page's call to a trapped animal in a cellar turns out to be more distressing than she could ever have imagined.
Integrity: Part 1: A new PC joins Sun Hill. Does he bring more crime with him than he is likely to fight?
Integrity: Part 2: Smith's involvement with a dangerous racist puts Brownlow's covert operation in jeopardy - and Klein's career on the line.
Cold Calling: Rawton and Meadows clash when a violent ex-con returns to Sun Hill.
Millennium: It only comes around every 1,000 years but life must go on for the Sun Hill team, as they grapple with millennial madness. DS Stanton has a tough first day in CID.
New mother Roseanne's past continues to haunt her, wreaking havoc on her family life, and a back injury forces Violet to put her beloved shop in the care of Fred.
Warmhearted drama. A spate of violent attacks on women impacts directly on the residents of Nonnatus House. A secret pregnancy threatens the life of a young girl.
Adaptation of the best-selling romance novel set in 1870s England. Annabella learns lessons in life the hard way when her father's debts catch up with him.
In the first of a two-part special, Caroline considers moving for a new job, and Celia and Alan become wrapped up in their amateur dramatics.
There's No 'I' In Slaughter: When a police team-building trip takes a sinister turn Sister Boniface must discover which of their rivals is a murderer.
Protection: A disturbing forensics mystery for Emilia Fox and team. When the body of a suspected paedophile is found in a playground, the death is linked to a missing child.
It's right back to the start of the ever-popular crime drama with British TV's favourite stars. The middle-aged detectives investigate the murder of a policewoman 17 years earlier.
New mother Roseanne's past continues to haunt her, wreaking havoc on her family life, and a back injury forces Violet to put her beloved shop in the care of Fred.
The Butterfly: Miep must choose between her morals and her best friend, and discovers her husband Jan is deliberately lying to her - but is he doing it out of love?
The Hudson River School: Corcoran finds himself evaluating his decisions. The arrival of a group of high-society out-of-towners offers Robert Morehouse a business opportunity.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
Sweet Smell of Success: Sitcom with Chigwell's most famous sisters. In an effort to raise some cash, Tracey thinks about selling Darryl's old car. Sharon becomes a saleswoman.
The Three Sergeants: Ackland, Boyden and Cryer are at each other's throats over the death of a prisoner in custody.
New. Final Accounts: Eva is devastated after the revelation that she may never be able to have children. Jimmi, whose words of reassurance fall on deaf ears, turns to Archie for support.
New. Managing Expectations: Joe helps a mother come to terms with her unmarried daughter's pregnancy, while Julia suggests George should stay at home to catch up with her paperwork.
A Twist of Fate: Mubbs ignores Rosie's advice to check a patient's medical records, and Ric is thrown a lifeline when a terminally ill patient asks him to perform an operation privately.
Inconvenient Truths: Charlie gets workshy Shona a job doing admin in the department, but her attitude fails to impress Kirsty.
The Three Sergeants: Ackland, Boyden and Cryer are at each other's throats over the death of a prisoner in custody.
New. As the police close in on the Mitchells, someone close points the finger of blame firmly at Peggy. Ronnie and Roxy are shocked when their long-missing mother arrives in Walford.
New. Ronnie and Roxy go over old wounds with their mother - but what does she really want? Zsa Zsa catches up with Shirley, but gets a lukewarm reception.
Brink of Disaster: The 1930s-based country vet series that paved the way for Sunday night entertainment as we know it. Siegfried is faced with an outbreak of foot-and-mouth.
Mr. Lee visits Anna with an offer of a second chance, but she continues to disobey him. Leo's jealousy is incited when Amanda flirts with Ken.
Ill Met By Moonlight: Frank and Lu must recover a precious jewel and a rebellious teenager before midnight strikes at Lady Bede's End of Summer Ball.
Disturbing the Peace: When Mr McKay leaves Slade prison, everyone is happy - until his replacement arrives. Contains outdated language.
It All Began with an Old Volvo Headlamp: Young-at-heart sitcom. A heartbroken Kevin needs a place to be alone, but problems arise when he decides to be the 'Wise Man of the Woods'.
The Lair of the Cat Creature: The 24th series of the long-running sitcom. When Alvin falls into their lives, Truly, Clegg and Billy try to help the failed bird-man find his niche.
Ancient Eastern Wisdom: An Introduction: Look for Burt Kwouk, AKA Inspector Clouseau's pal Cato, in this episode of the Yorkshire-set sitcom. Truly and Clegg meet handyman Entwistle.
Popular Appeal: The uncompromising High Court judge continues his fight against crime and corruption. During a reality TV show, one contestant kills another on camera.
It's right back to the start of the ever-popular crime drama with British TV's favourite stars. The middle-aged detectives investigate the murder of a policewoman 17 years earlier.
Ill Met By Moonlight: Frank and Lu must recover a precious jewel and a rebellious teenager before midnight strikes at Lady Bede's End of Summer Ball.
